channel.title: Mac programs
channel.description:
My sister has a Macbook Pro and it has these cool programs, so I send them to my computer over the network or whatever the hell I did, and the files for GarageBand are on my desktop. I'd like to know how to run these programs that are made for Mac on Windows, if there is a way. I don't feel like downloading some virus off google that says garageband for windows. Not going to take a risk when I already have the program's files but don't know how to run it. If you know how to run it, share it with me :3
Thanks.

item.title: Mac programs
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

To be honest you can run Windows programs on Macs with an application so one would assume you could do it the other way round. Not everyone knows you can’t, if that’s the case.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac programs
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

it seems like a troll to everyone who knows. this knowledge is so basic its almost common sense. its like asking will a 64-bit program run on a 32-bit OS(though on mac os x, 64-bit applications run even when the mac is running in 32-bit mode[kernel is running in 32-bit]), or can you install 64-bit on a 32-bit cpu.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac programs
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

pretty sure there isnt a solution. unless someone has created a WINE-like program except for mac instead of windows. A mac app is stored in a folder, so everything that the program requires to run is in that. mac programs are written in objective-c. sorry but the change of running native mac programs on anything other than mac is up to the developer to port their code to windows(which i doubt since the developer is apple itself.).

feel free to create such a program but it will take quite some time probably not worth your time, plus you may run into legal issues.

But you can run a mac os in a vm on a windows pc. that is if your computer will allow it. I have one running on my laptop but it doesnt run very well and isnt that stable.

if you would like to do that then try looking here: http://lifehacker.com/5583650/run-mac-os-x-in-virtualbox-on-windows

whether garage band will run or not after all that work is another story.

Read full topic
